intro: Balanocarpus wrayi, commonly known as the African ebony, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood that is highly valued for its durability and aesthetic qualities. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth margin. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Balanocarpus wrayi is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and hill forest areas.
